alert.note: Alert for Utah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 4:23PM MDT until August 12 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE POLE CANYON BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTH CENTRAL UTAH COUNTY... At 423 PM MDT, Doppler radar reported between .50"-1.00" of rainfall from earlier thunderstorms over the Pole Canyon Burn Scar. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through Blind Canyon and other adjacent drainages. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Pole Canyon Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Pole Canyon Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Birdseye. This includes the following highways... US Route 89 between mile markers 302...312. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
